channel.title: Nature Materials
channel.description: Nature Materials is a multidisciplinary journal aimed at bringing together cutting-edge research across the entire spectrum of materials science and technology. Nature Materials covers all applied and fundamental aspects of the synthesis/processing, structure/composition, properties and performance of materials. Nature Materials provides a forum for the development of a common identity among materials scientists while encouraging researchers to cross established subdisciplinary lines. To achieve this, Nature Materials takes an interdisciplinary, integrated and balanced approach to all areas of materials research while fostering the exchange of ideas between scientists involved in different communities.

item.title: Frustration under the microscope
item.content:encoded:
Nature Materials, Published online: 09 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02335-2

By tuning and mapping Josephson currents at the atomic scale, researchers uncover how competing superconducting phases in FeSe interfere, revealing the fingerprints of s±-wave pairing and frustrated Josephson coupling.
item.dc:title: Frustration under the microscope
item.dc:creator: Nicolas Bergeal

item.title: Capturing the dance of nanoparticles in crystals
item.content:encoded:
Nature Materials, Published online: 09 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02342-3

Phonon dynamics of self-assembled two-dimensional nanoparticle crystals is resolved by liquid-phase transmission electron microscopy.
item.dc:title: Capturing the dance of nanoparticles in crystals
item.dc:creator: Eric Shen
Oleg Gang

item.title: Re-entrant phase behaviour of organic semiconductors
item.content:encoded:
Nature Materials, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02348-x

Insights to elucidate the composition–behaviour relationship in organic photovoltaic materials are required. Here the phase behaviour of disordered polymer:small-molecule acceptor blends is studied and an extended model is invoked to understand the temperature–composition diagrams.
item.dc:title: Re-entrant phase behaviour of organic semiconductors
item.dc:creator: Zhengxing Peng
Masoud Ghasemi
Jasper J. Michels
Harald Ade

item.title: Space-time crystals from particle-like topological solitons
item.content:encoded:
Nature Materials, Published online: 04 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41563-025-02344-1

A continuous mesoscale space-time crystal phase is reported from a nematic liquid crystal driven by light.
item.dc:title: Space-time crystals from particle-like topological solitons
item.dc:creator: Hanqing Zhao
Ivan I. Smalyukh
